text:
I am a third-year student at Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), pursuing BSc in Mathematics. As a first-generation university student, I am honored to be a recipient of the Brunei Darussalam Government Scholarship for Foreign Students (BDGS), recognizing my commitment to academic excellence and leadership.
I aspire to contribute to projects that applies mathematical methods in solving global challenges. A recent project of mine, Spatial Autocorelation of Schools, supervised by Dr.¬†Haziq Jamil, examined the spatial distributions of schools in Brunei using R programming language. Datasets from this work contributed to the development of the {bruneimap} package.
Currently, I am exploring climate data analysis and expanding my technical skills by learning Python. Outside of academics, I stay active through sports, particularly swimming, table tennis, and badminton. Whether I‚Äôm coding, in the pool, or on the court, I am always eager to learn, grow and make a meaningful impact!

text:
Starting late 2024, I began contributing to the Brunei R User group, a community dedicated to R programming. As part of the logistics team, I handle venue coordination, seating arrangements, and equipment setup to ensure meetups run smoothly and offer a seamless, enjoyable experience for all participants.
I served as the speaker for the group‚Äôs first 2025 meetup, where I delivered a talk on Spatial Data Analysis using the newly released {bruneimap} package. As a contributor to the package, I showcased its key features: Brunei spatial boundaries & datasets, and demonstrated practical applications and visualization built using this data.

title: Experience
text:
Swimming
I began swimming at the age of six, starting with local and regional competitions. I remember staying late after school for training, driven by the goal of joining the national team and competing internationally. After years of dedication and perseverance, I earned a spot on the national team in 2018 and was honored to represent Brunei in the ASEAN School Games in 2018 and 2019. I retired from competitive swimming in 2020 to focus on my professional life.
The greatest lesson I took from swimming is the importance of discipline, committing to a routine, and pushing through challenges.

title: Experience
text:
Table Tennis
In university, I started playing table tennis casually with friends in the university club. Over time, I became more involved and was appointed Secretary and Vice Chair of the club. In these role, I collaborate closely with the Chair in strategic planning and execution of club‚Äôs vision by coordinating events and supporting members as well as managing club documentation (membership records, club proposals, meeting minutes).
In February 2025, I was selected to represent my university in the Chancellor‚Äôs Trophy (Inter-University Games) for doubles table tennis event, where my partner and I secured 1st place. Transitioning from an individual sport (swimming) to a team-based one, taught me the value of teamwork, and how to adapt, communicate, and coordinate effectively with a partner to achieve a shared goal.
